answers.answer: None of that is healthy for a pregnancy. The amount of caffeine in 44oz of Mountain Dew is too much for a pregnant women to be consuming in a day and if she continues to consume that much sugar she risks getting gestational diabetes.
Just realized I didn't read that correctly lol. Good for you for turning her down on the junk food because you are right it could be harmful especially if you already have diabetes.
I'm the one who is pregnant not her. She can have all that stuff, the problem is she keeps getting it and asking me if I want it.

Well thats not nice of her at all. Maybe you should take her to a dr appointment and have the dr tell her about diabetes and how it effects not only you but your little one as well. She just may need a teality check. I hope she becomes more supportive of you hun. Good luck.
First of all, yay you for staying strong and saying no. Next, maybe have her go to the next appt & have the doc explain the possibilities of what could happen.

I can't agree more with the posters above......Kudos to you for turning down all the tempting items (our cravings can be difficult to turn down) and holding your own. And also agree that maybe your partner should come in and have the conversation with you and your doctor/midwife on the way she should be supporting you during this time, especially with the trials and tribulations of having diabetes. Good luck!!!!

I think it's great that you are doing whats best for you and the baby. But your partner is grown and can do what she wants and eat what she wants. I see how it can suck not being able to have it and she shouldn't be eating and drinking it right in front of you if your diabetic and pregnant she should respect your feelings more than that. just my opinion

question: I love my partner and i love that we are starting a family together but i want to slap her! I'm type 2 diabetic who us trying to stay away from sugar. Just in the last 6 hours she had drank 44 ounce of Mt dew, eaten cake and then ice cream. She keeps offering these things to me knowing I am not supposed to have them. I try to explain to her that these things are bad for me and the baby but she says oh a little bit won't hurt you. But a little bit can hurt us. I just wish she would listen!
title: annoyed!!!!
